meanings.definition: A large drinking cup with a handle and a hinged cover, typically made of silver or pewter.
meanings.sent1: At the medieval fair, the knight drank from a shiny tankard.
meanings.sent2: The tavern keeper served ale in heavy tankards to the thirsty patrons.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous jester used a tankard as a makeshift helmet, much to the amusement of the crowd.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a tankard overflowing with memories of joy and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The tankard gleamed in the firelight, inviting all to share in its contents.

meanings.definition: A large beer mug, typically made of metal or ceramic.
meanings.sent1: During Oktoberfest, the revelers clinked their tankards together in celebration.
meanings.sent2: The brewery offered personalized tankards for loyal customers to enjoy their brews.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter accidentally dropped a stack of tankards, causing a comical commotion.
meanings.sent4: His thirst for adventure was as vast as a bottomless tankard of ale.
meanings.sent5: The tankard stood proudly on the shelf, a symbol of good times shared with friends.
